content:
Why is the tag "Bin packing" used here? ðŸ¤”

Same question for this puzzle: https://www.codingame.com//training/easy/ascii-art-the-drunken-bishop-algorithm

Thanks.

Would the author please take a look at the forum thread? I'm really confused...

https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-ascii-art-qr-code/199619/

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I enjoyed the idea of an ASCII QR Code, and it was fun to solve.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Outstanding puzzle! I did not know a single thing about QR codes before doing this puzzle and I thoroughly enjoyed the learning process. To be honest, I was completely confused after reading your Goal a couple of times. Then I went to the Wikipedia page and finally I watched a video on decoding QR codes. Knowing what I know now, your Goal section is straightforward and I don't have any changes to recommend. In hindsight, I like that your puzzle pushed me to do some external research. Great job!

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting puzzle.
Statement is clear & difficulty level is adequate.

Very nice one!

It would have been fun to have rotated QR codes! :-)

Really enjoyed solving this puzzle.
Needed to read the statement a couple of times to understand everything, the last changes definitely made it better.

A couple of remarks:
-For the mask pattern example I would just fill it all, the dots got me confused at first but that could be just me.

-For the layout, I would replace "it turns left and changes ..." by "it moves left and changes ..."

-For the data encoding I would only use 0 & 1, if you really want to use space & not space is should in the data column and not in the result column.  

-You could add a test/validator with no columns or no rows between the detection markers, maybe some implementations would not handle that properly, you never know.

Interesting puzzle and nice work.

All sections
* Please change "QRcode" to "QR code" (3 times).

Input section
* Suggest to add "for the width of the QR code" to the description of Line 1.

* Suggest to add "for the height of the QR code" to the description of Line 2.

Output section
* Suggest to delete "ASCII String".

Goal section
* Suggest to add a blank line above <<Structure>>.

* Suggest to add a blank line above <<Encryption algorithm>>.

* Please change "are stored" to "is stored".

* "Structure" point 1 and point 4: Please format W and H as [[variables]].

* "Structure" point 2: Please change "1 char tick line of spaces" to "spaces of 1 character thick".

* "Structure" point 2: Suggest to change ", fixed size 5x3" to ". Each position detection marker is indicated by a 5x3 rectangle made up of {{+}}, {{-}} and {{|}} with an {{@}} character in the centre".

* "Structure" point 3: Please change "chars"/"char" to "characters"/"character".

* "Structure" point 3: Suggest to change ", fixed size 3x3" to ". The alignment marker is indicated by a 3x3 square made up of {{+}}, {{-}} and {{|}} with an {{X}} character in the centre".

* "Structure" point 4: Please add "which is" before "not space".

* "Structure" point 5: Suggest to add "of 0s and 1s" after "checkerboard pattern".

* "Structure" point 5: Please change "does not stops" to "does not stop".

* "Layout": Suggest to change "that cannot be used e.g. markers" to "the four markers and the no data zones".

* "Layout": Seems that the description is not that accurate? I mean the bitstream does not turn left and change direction when it meets the alignment marker. The bitstream just crosses the marker straight.

* "Layout": Suggest to change "uppercase is 1" to "1 for uppercase".

* "Layout": Place change "position markers" to "position detection markers" for consistency.

* "Data Encoding": Do you mean "raw data" instead of "row data"?

* "Encryption algorithm": Please change "the all" to "all".

* I'm confused (maybe rewrite a bit if possible). Do you mean:

(a) If the message is not encrypted, then the available space in the QR code is filled with
    â€¢ BOM (not XORed with mask pattern)
    â€¢ message + EOM (XORed with mask pattern)
    â€¢ BOM (not XORed with mask pattern)
    â€¢ message + EOM (XORed with mask pattern)
    â€¢ â€¦ repeated until all space is filled?

(b) If the message is encrypted, then the available space in the QR code is filled with
    â€¢ BOM (not XORed with mask pattern/encryption key)
    â€¢ message + EOM (XORed with mask pattern and encryption key)
    â€¢ BOM (not XORed with mask pattern/encryption key)
    â€¢ message + EOM (XORed with mask pattern and encryption key)
    â€¢ â€¦ repeated until all space is filled?

Cases
* I think it's better to revise the validators so that they have different expected outputs from the corresponding tests.

Thanks.
I think I have fixed everything, I hope I have clarified some doubts on the final part. Thanks for your patience and support!
I think I fixed all. I added a new test w=12 H=8 (and changed the constraints) to obtain QR code with no rows and cols. Thanks!
Thanks, that was the purpose too

The message ends with the first EOM. Repeating the raw data is a trick to fill the available space. if it creates confusion, I can modify the text saying to ignore the data after EOM, because it is a filler.
I did not remove test/val 6. should I put it back or it is necessary to dig deeper to understand how it happened?
Fixed. Thanks!

I don't see a reason for removing the cases, so I suggest you to put them back.

As for understanding how that happened, I hope it's an isolated incident so I won't dig deeper. It's ok if you want to dig deeper, though. But in any case, if a similar thing happens again, I'll definitely ask CG staff to investigate.
fixed. Thanks!

My confusion arises because:
(1) I don't have to write any code to detect repetition in order to pass all the cases.
(2) The statement mentions that "the raw data are repeated... subsequent copies may be truncated", so I was thinking there may be such test cases.
(3) The Output section mentions that "only the first copy" of the message should be output, further giving me the impression that there may be such test cases.

Suggestions:
(1) If my understanding is correct, I would suggest to change
"Inside the raw data (bitstream) the structure is:"
to
"Inside one copy of the raw data (bitstream) the structure is:"
because it is still a bit unclear to me whether the raw data refers to a single copy or repeated copies.

(2) Are there any such cases of repeated raw data in the puzzle? If not, please mention that in the Constraints section. Please also remove "only the first copy" in Output section.

Thanks.
Thanks for you comments, I modified as suggested. I added a new test case with sufficient space to hold repeating message, let me know if this clarifies the doubts

Thank you! I'm all clear now!

I suggested to remove "(only the first copy)" in Output section because there wasn't a test case on repeated messages. But now that there are such cases, "(only the first copy)" should be added back.

Thanks again.

Isn't W=12 H=8 impossible? With that one you get 15 bits of data but the minimum should be 8 (BOM) + 7 (1 character) + 7 (EOM) so 22 bits.
I was referring to a test where there's either no rows or no cols, something like W=12 & H>=9 or W>=12 & H = 8
Hi, You are right. I fixed it with W=12,H=12. Thanks!
Thank you, I think it's better now. The remaining outstanding point is revising the validators.
I fixed tests and validators. Thanks!
